channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who Said Vacuums Can’t Be Cute?
item.description: Worx’s petite cube vacuum appeals to my desire for cleanliness, control, and cute things in my life.

item.title: Stumbling and Overheating, Most Humanoid Robots Fail to Finish Half Marathon in Beijing
item.description: Only four of the 21 robots in the race crossed the finish line, highlighting just how far humanoids are from keeping up with their real human counterp...

item.title: Best iPad to Buy (and Some to Avoid) in 2025
item.description: We break down the current iPad lineup to help you figure out which one of Apple’s tablets is best for you.

item.title: 18 Best Apple Watch Accessories (2025): Bands, Chargers, Cases, and Screen Protectors
item.description: You finally caved and bought an Apple Watch. These are our favorite straps, screen protectors, chargers, and cases to go with it.

item.title: Week in Review: Google loses a major antitrust case
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! We’ve got tons of stuff for you this week: antitrust lawsuits against Google and Meta; Grok can now remember; Bolt CEO...

item.title: Read what Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook execs said about Instagram before buying it
item.description: The first week of the Meta antitrust trial brought new revelations about how the company formerly known as Facebook approached the competitive threat ...

item.title: Famed AI researcher launches controversial startup to replace all human workers everywhere
item.description: Every now and then, a Silicon Valley startup launches with such an “absurdly” described mission that it’s difficult to discern if the startup is for r...

item.title: Robots run a half marathon, slowly
item.description: It looks like humanoid robots have a long way to go before catching up with human runners. Beijing’s E-Town tech hub hosted what it described as the f...

item.title: An AI Customer Service Chatbot Made Up a Company Policy—and Created a Mess
item.description: When an AI model for code-editing company Cursor hallucinated a new rule, users revolted.

item.title: Congress has questions about 23andMe bankruptcy
